attributes.action: Call to account the Heads of departments responsible for BBC News programmes.
attributes.additional_details:
BBC TV and radio have demonstrated clear bias in their reporting pre- and post-Brexit.
It is clear that the BBC agenda was to support a Remain vote, and it continues to promote anti-Brexit sentiment, undermining the will of the people and the aims of Her Majesty's Government. 

A Parliamentary Select Committee should call to account those described above, where they can refute the allegations before Members of Parliament, and  a complete change of news presenters should be effected.
attributes.background: BBC news and current affairs (radio and TV) coverage pre- and post- the country's vote to leave the European Union on 23rd June has been biased - this attempted to undermine the Leave campaign and, since the vote, has attempted to undermine the democratic wishes of the majority of the electorate.

rejection.details:
We can't accept a petition calling for a change of BBC news presenters, because the BBC is operationally independent of the Government and Parliament.

You could start a new petition asking the House of Commons to refer the matter of the BBC's news programmes to a select committee, or to establish a new committee to look specifically at this subject.
